analyzed: theḥ apadāna  padu mukkhi pa vagga
translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Padumuttara
“On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
Raising my hands in respectful salutation,
looking up at the Great Sage;
I bowed to the Best of Men;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of paying homage.
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā javahaṁsako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā javahasakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus did the Elder Javahaṁsaka recite these verses.
The Elder Javahaṁsaka’s Birth Story is the seventh.
